cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a mobile edge computing (MEC) framework for delivering virtual reality (VR) videos over wireless networks. This involves optimizing task scheduling to minimize communication-resource consumption under a delay constraint. The paper touches on topics such as caching, computation, and communication, which are relevant to several arXiv CS sub-categories. However, given the focus on wireless networks and mobile devices, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely sub-category. Other relevant sub-categories include cs.MM (Multimedia), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), and cs.SY (Systems and Control).
